title: Poster, Clayfest No. 8, for the Herron Gallery, Indianapolis Center for Contemporary Art, 1992
title_raw: Clayfest No. 8, for the Herron Gallery, Indianapolis Center for Contemporary Art
medium: screen print on cardboard (french dur-o-tone paper)
markings: Verso: UR corner white paper label affixed with tape: Title: Clayfest No.8 Poster / Date: 1992 / Description: Poster / Designer: Jim Ross / Design Firm: Mirelez/Ross, Inc. / Client: Herron Gallery / Production by: Serigraphics
inscribed:
In blue, lower half of poster: enclosed in heavy blue line block, HERRON SCHOOL OF ART / 1701 N. PENNSYLVANIA ST. / INDIANAPOLIS, IN. 46202 / 317 920-2420 / MONDAY - THURSDAY / 10:00 AM to 7:00 PM / FRIDAY 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM. To the left of the text are three logos: Amaco; IUPUI and IIAC
Across bottom of sheet in blue: These exhibitions are funded in part by The Mary Howes / Woodsmall Foundation, American Art Clay Co., Inc., the Friends / of Herron, the Indiana Arts Commission and the National / Endowment for the Arts.
description:
Dark blue sans serif typography with a heavy blue border on gray cardboard. The letters of the title, in upper quadrant, and also text at bottom of sheet, are tangent to borders. Center justification text reads as follows: HERRON GALLERY / Indianapolis Center for Contemporary Art / CLAYFEST No. 8 / A Juried Biennial of / INDIANA CERAMIC ARTISTS / [in script] and / AMACO SELECTS: TEN YEARS / OF CERAMIC WORKSHOPS / DECEMBER 5, 1992 - JANUARY 8, 1993
Address block follows. Acknowledgements across bottom of sheet.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, Clayfest No. 8, for the Herron Gallery, Indianapolis Center for Contemporary Art, 1992. screen print on cardboard (french dur-o-tone paper). Gift of Mario Mirelez. 1994-125-1.
